website_summaries.verdict: A decent kit for beginners who aren’t quite ready to invest in more expensive individual router bits. Lubricating the bearings is essential to prolonging their life, and they aren’t meant for heavy-duty application.
pros: Users are happy with the broad assortment of router bits in this set, with some comparing it favorably to sets priced above $100
cons: Reports of bits shattering or bearings flying off under moderate use
Hardwoods are a no-go with these bits

customer_reviews.title: Bargain set but breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: The set is a bargain, but unfortunately for me, while using the 1/4" straight bit to cut a groove in some MDF board, the bit broke in half. I attached a picture to show where the bit broke. I'm just glad that amazon.com is really good with their refund policy, I'll be getting a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: FromtheShadows

customer_reviews.title: routing super soft pine
customer_reviews.text: Just got these today, routing super soft pine, two different bits edges shattered in under a foot of work. Garbage.
customer_reviews.author: CTM

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality bearings.
customer_reviews.text: Title says my main complaint. After less than 1 foot of total usage of the roman ogee bit, the bearing flew apart and ruined my wood. I've used a couple other bits for short runs, but now I fear using these bits and ruining an expensive project. If I had to redo it, I'd just buy a quality roman ogee bit and call it good. I went down to the hardware store and bought one anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Buy them...but know they'll break...quickly/later/maybe(?)never
customer_reviews.text: These are good bits. On a scale from 1-10 they are a 5-6. For value they are close to a 9/10 because a 10/10 would be a free decent set and this set is only cheap not free. The ball bearings of A few, 2-3 of 20(?) bits just went flying while routing...only after using for a few feet of "routed edge." But there are a lot of them left.....for the time being. WEAR EYE PROTECTION, These things can go flying. But note: bits can be used without bearings for less smooth routing.
customer_reviews.author: JW/Ni

customer_reviews.title: Good for soft reviews and beginners, not good for hard woods and multiple uses
customer_reviews.text: For the price it’s a good starter bit set if you are working on soft woods but the moment you bring harder woods into the mix it can jam up and cause damage to the wood. For reference I am using a new Makita cordless brushless router on full battery charge. After just a few uses the blades started to dull requiring multiple attempts to route. Ended up going to Home Depot and buying new bits to complete the job. Shame on me for trying to buy a cheap pack for the job But again, if you are working on soft woods this is a good buy. Just not for anything stronger
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Rubin

customer_reviews.title: Low price...poor quality...
customer_reviews.text: So far I've only used the 1/4" straight bit. I was cutting a channel in some 2x4 boards about 3' in length. The bit made it through the first board just fine. About 90% of the way through the second board the bit snapped in half. I'll give this the benefit of the doubt and give 3 stars simply because of the variety of bits in the set but if they're all as poor quality as the one I used today, it really isn't much of a bargain at all. UPDATE: The bearings on these bits are terrible. So far three out of three have flown apart with very little use...downgrading to 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: J-Hill

customer_reviews.title: Zero Durability
customer_reviews.text: With router bits (and most tools, for that matter) you get what you pay for. Less than 5 minutes of light use and the bearing on the flush trim bit disintegrated, ruining the piece I was working on. Other bits haven’t had any issues (yet), but haven’t been used very much. They’re cheap and might work fine for you, but don’t set your expectations too high.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Can't be trusted
customer_reviews.text: One of the bits came with a broken bearing, right out of the box. That was a bit concerning, but I figured I'd give the other bits a try. It's a big set, so I just swapped the bearing from another bit. Anyway, on my first project using a different bit, the bearing blew up, ruining my board in the process. I wasn't super happy about that, but mostly I was disappointed because I felt like I couldn't trust any of the bits from then on. I can't have them failing and damaging my projects. So the whole thing turned out to be a big waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Wordimont

customer_reviews.title: Router bearings are WEAK!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product a few months back and finally got around to using some of round-over bits with the bearing on the bottom. Was able to route about 10 LF of a pine board (softwood) and SNAP! there went my 1/8” round over. I figured well.. let’s try another. Maybe it was a fluke. Swapped the 1/8” round over for a 3/16” round over and started back on my project. 20 LF later... SNAP! There goes another bit and another ruined edge on the piece I was working on. Wouldn’t recommend these bits to anyone. You get what you pay for. Bosch is where it’s at. Maybe would consider revising this review if the seller would replace these bits.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Straight Bits will do, avoid the bearings on these...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this set to test out some bit shapes before upgrading them to higher quality units. The straight bit I used worked fine, but i get the feeling that it will dull fairly quickly. My main issue was with the flush cut bit. The bearing on the end broke on just the 2nd pass. Luckily I was just using it to trace a template for some Halloween decorations so nothing of value was damaged when it failed. I would not recommend this set simply because even low cost should last longer than this did. (photo shows where the bearing SHOULD have been...)
customer_reviews.author: DRL

customer_reviews.title: They are pretty good for amateurs
customer_reviews.text: I actually not familiar with the brand but I saw it in HomeDepot and bought it from Amazon. Both ship it but on Amazon I get 5% cash back. It’s basically for weekend warriors and not something you would use in a big shop. The boys are small and good enough for an amateur. I’ve Ben using these with my HF router for many projects now and they always deliver good results! Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: LoLa

customer_reviews.title: VERY good quality
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at the quality of these bits ! I was not at my shop but 500 miles away working on a cabinet in our mountain home and did not have the correct bit in my toolbox. I went to Home D_____ & Lo____ and both had a cost of one bit more then what I pain for this set via Amazon. and I received these the NEXT DAY .... I used the one size for 7 different places and the other size in 2 places,,,, both worked to 100% of what I needed !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Martin Harris

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but not for high end work.
customer_reviews.text: I knew what I was getting when I ordered these and I was not expecting a set of Feud bits. I use these when I'm out building decorative cedar fences and sometimes I want to add a detail on the top cap or it I am encasing post. It was an affordable set with case that I could throw in the truck or trailer and know they were there when I needed them. I would suggest to anyone that is looking of a good selection or is starting to use routers and wants to play around with different styles.
customer_reviews.author: Parker Cole Travis

customer_reviews.title: These are good for practicing your routing skills, before destroying your good bits.
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect to get a set of good routing bits for this cheap, it just isn't going to happen. However, these will help you get better at using a router. Just a word of caution, before using the bits that have bearings on them. They can blow out and sling those bearing balls all over the place, so make sure to wear PPE, and don't go showing off to your buddies unless you intend to kill somebody-because this a good way to do it.
customer_reviews.author: jason yates

customer_reviews.title: Failed to meet low expectations
customer_reviews.text: I threw them out. The bearings are not aligned with the shank. The bearings burn and stick. The bearings fall off the cutters are not really sharp, requiring moderate sanding when used. Get some real bits, these are junk. I have wasted enough wood because these bits failed that I could have bought a quality set of bits by now instead of replacement material.
customer_reviews.author: New York tradesman

customer_reviews.title: Not all bits are created equal
customer_reviews.text: So... I was really really happy about this product when it first came. Everything seemed in order and I was very pleased with the value I was getting. I went to go start a project and thought to myself. Oh wait - I have a rabetting bit in my new set! let me go grab that to make some quick rabbets. Something I had not been able to do before this set was in my life. Well - the set doesn't have the right bit in that slot - its another roundover bit. Too bad I didn't need that bit till after the return period. A little sad at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Shopper

customer_reviews.title: If you're like me, who only needs to roundover or apply ...
customer_reviews.text: The carrying case and profile graphics for each bit are simple but a real bonus. If you're like me, who only needs to roundover or apply a profile to a piece of wood occasionally, this set is a must buy. Bits are a decent quality in my opinion - but for less than $2/bit can you really go wrong? Haven't used any individual bit super hard, but then I guess if you did you wouldn't buy a set like this to begin with. No complaints here!
customer_reviews.author: Sam B.

customer_reviews.title: and it comes with a good mix of bearings that you can interchange
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set of bits for a few shelf projects I wanted to make with MDF. I didn't want to spend too much money on some high end bits that would get abused and dulled by the MDF boards. I had read some reviews from users saying that the bits have broken after 1 or 2 uses. I've already used these its on 5 projects and I've got no problems to report. The cuts are smooth and accurate, and it comes with a good mix of bearings that you can interchange, along with a hex tool. I am not expecting these bits to last a lifetime, but for the cost of the set I think they're a good value!
customer_reviews.author: L. Franco

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy - these bits are dangerous and could ruin your project.
customer_reviews.text: I used the rabbiting bit from this set one time - after cutting about 3 feet of board, the bearing completely disassembled. Thank god it was my push block that took the damage when the bit unexpectedly broke through the surface of the wood, rather than my fingers. The bearing collided with the bit as well, and shot off my routing table at about 50 mph - good way to lose some dental work. Do not buy these bits. They are poorly made, they don't cut cleanly, they will not last, and apparently they have a tendency to simply fall apart during use.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: great router bits at an even better price.
customer_reviews.text: for the price you would think you would get subpar router bits but that is not the case, these router bits are great and for people who are just starting in woodworking or someone looking to pick up a few extra bits at a good price these are a great option. I have had to sharpen one or two as I use them more than others but I have no complaints at all they cut through a lot of different hardwoods without a problem, and I can imagine I will be using this set for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Hopper55

customer_reviews.title: WORST SET EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a terrible set. The bits were not sharp at all. When I used them they were bucking and kicking the wood. A good amount of tear out obviously occurred. These were completely unusable. I gave them 2 stars just so people would read it, but it really is a 1 star. The case was appropriate for the price though.
customer_reviews.author: Mobius

customer_reviews.title: Starter Set
customer_reviews.text: This is a good starter set for somebody who is new to routers. They aren't the highest quality bits but they're good for the price. They aren't as sharp as some higher end bits which means you will probably see some burning on the wood you are routing. The box also leaves something to be desired as it is pretty rough and almost splintery. I threw on a coat of finishing wax which smoothed it right out and I now have a pretty nice box for the set. I recommend buying this set with the expectation that you will likely replace some of the bits you'd use more often sometime down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Scot

customer_reviews.title: The honest cold hard truth.
customer_reviews.text: These bits are junk. This really isn't a surprise to you though, deep down you know they are and you're just being a cheap a$$ and thinking these might work for you. Maybe you say " I'm a beginner" or " I only need to use them every now and then" but, believe me when I say that there are some things you can go cheap on and something's you just can't. Buy once cry once.
customer_reviews.author: lyky

customer_reviews.title: blade snapped off
customer_reviews.text: Scariest router bit I've ever had. Routing with thea 3/4 inch straight bit on soft pine - the one of the blades just went flying off the bit at a 1000 miles/h. I was lucky no one was in its path. not using any of these bits anymore. they're a hazard in my opinion. ordered a Bosch set - i'd rather keep my eyesight, thank you
customer_reviews.author: Enough BS

customer_reviews.title: This is a great starter variety bit set
customer_reviews.text: This is a great starter variety set. The pictures of each cut are very helpful, especially to those who are new to owning/using a router. The cost is pretty great too for the number of bits. They might not be top notch, but this kit will give you an idea of which bits you like best, so you dont have to spend a ton of money buying the best of everything before ever using it.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Mixon

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: The bits aren't very strong and they seem to get dull after not a lot of use. The box they come in is really handy and they're oiled and ready to go. I like that the box keeps them organized. I really debated with myself on buying this set but I couldn't resist the price. Well, you get what you pay for. In hindsight, I wish I would have just bought the 2 or 3 bits that I needed. It's probably okay if you're doing some very light routering.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice box, seem to work well
customer_reviews.text: Nice box, seem to work well, but I have only used one radius bit so far. Had a shaving wrap around the cutter beneath the bearing and locked it to the cutter and left burn marks on the wood. I am not a pro by any means, and will add more later.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Junk bearings
customer_reviews.text: You might as well throw away any of the bits with the bearings otherwise they’ll just shoot off. I’ve tightened them down and even tried thread locker but 5 of the 5 I’ve used have all lost their bearings. Do not buy this set.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Nice set, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not sure that I would use for production work but very suitable for DIY. The bits are well made and the 3 that I've used so far cut cleanly, no chatter, no jumping. You get a nice set of cutters that will cover common needs. I'm using to create custom molding and trim pieces for back porch ceiling and have been well pleased with ease of use and results.
customer_reviews.author: Del

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, nice storage box...
customer_reviews.text: Fairly quality, almost every bit I might want to use. Nice storage box to keep them organized and safe. NOTE: If you appreciated this review please give it a “thumbs up/like” your helping me to continue to give honest/unbiased insight into products I’ve used and you may have questions about. Interested in a product but don't know enough about it and would like it reviewed? Please let me know and I'll see what I can do... Thank you 🙏
customer_reviews.author: Symbols Of LoveTop Contributor: Swimming

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've been happily using these drill bits for 6-7 months now. I was very hesitant to purchase them as I knew it would be of lesser quality than some other brand name bits. That being said, given the price, I decided to buy to find out for myself. At the end of the day, they work fantastically. I'm a frequent hobbyist and I have no desire to buy anything of better quality than this. Also, I've purchased a few Freud drill bits for different purpose---these feel like they're somewhat in par with Freud in terms of built quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sum_it

customer_reviews.title: Junk, so don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on these bits. CHEAP metal and breaks easily. Running stright 1/4 in bit in red cedar doing 1/8 in passes and bit broke in half. Wrote the company and no reply in over a week. Get Freud if you can afford them or Irwin makes a good set as well. I tried to go cheaper and have now paid the price of shoddy bits.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas J Erwin

customer_reviews.title: Look Great but don't seem to hold up very well.
customer_reviews.text: At first glace these look like OK bits, however the very first time I used them, I was doing some trim work the bearing on the trim bit disintegrated and almost ruined my work piece. I guess that's why they were on sale. don't know what type of warranty the company has on these, I still have the choice to return them though, I'll have to see what the company says
customer_reviews.author: Douglas A. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: The way the case is made, the bits are difficult to remove. The lower retainer had come loose in shipping and several bits became dislodged. The bit perform as expected during use. They are ok for the price. This set will provide the user with an idea of what bits you will use on a regular basis to purchase quality pieces.
customer_reviews.author: chip

customer_reviews.title: Starter set
customer_reviews.text: I saw a video on Youtube that suggested buying an inexpensive set to start and then replace the lower quality blades with better ones as I discover which ones I use the most. This set has almost all of the basics. I think it will be a good starting point.
customer_reviews.author: Chris "The Wolf"

customer_reviews.title: Get dull quickly
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Don't let the looks and price fool you. I used 6 or 7 different bits out of the set and it took only about 80 ft for the 1/2" bit to get dull. Granted it was oak hardwood, but routed in 2' increments with several minutes of doing something else in between. The other bits I used did not even last that long.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Decent product
customer_reviews.text: I don't know about long heavy building projects, but for diy it is doing a great job. Cuts are clean, easy to use for trim work and light duty around the house. Used for trimming around a desk and making cuts for desk drawers on oak and pine wood.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Wish they were made better
customer_reviews.text: The box they come in is pretty cool but is cheap compressed wood and after a few uses the nails started coming out of it and After using these bits I would say the price is what got me to buy them for sure they are very cheaply made and the bits without bearings perform ok but the bearings are junk and fly apart way to easy but after replacing the bearings with ones I ordered from another supplier they are ok bits
customer_reviews.author: Guy B.

customer_reviews.title: Know what you are buying: Great starter set, not so great precision/high end woodwork set.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for, so I can only recommend it if you are beginner or unsure which profiles you want to actually spend money on. Two important things to look out for when you get these: 1. Make sure you lubricate all the bearings prior to use. Many of mine would barely turn right out of the box. 2. Check under the bearing for powder coat slough. Apparently they coat them right up the bearing shaft and then press the bearing on. A number of mine had hardened coating right up against the bearing which contributed to some of them not turning freely.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in a broken case.
customer_reviews.text: My router but set arrived in a broken case. The shipping box was not damaged and there was lots of air bags for cushions. The person who put it in the box either knew the case was broken or broke it when placing it into the shipping box. Just waiting on the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: islandremix

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent for the money. if you want them to last inspect them first bearings and all. Do not force cut or make to many cuts without adequate cooling time in between.Let the tool/blade do the work dont force it. If you don't follow these simple things the "best" bits on earth will break just as easy. I've only had these for 2 months but no broken bits yet. My sample size of 1 kit is very small and maybe i got lucky but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan L.

customer_reviews.title: Nice variety, appears good quality
customer_reviews.text: Just received these router bits and they look great! I like the sturdy box they came in, and the image below each bit on what they do. This is a great and very affordable set to fit my needs. They appear sturdy, sharp and good quality. I'll update more info after I try them out. Very fast shipping too!
customer_reviews.author: Teenie Weenies

customer_reviews.title: They are as advertised though I had doubted them.
customer_reviews.text: For some time I have thought these were the wrong size for my craftsman router. However, I discovered yesterday, the reason I have not been able to use my Craftsman router is not because these were made slightly larger than they should have been, but because the router collet is the wrong size. (It was advertised as 1/4 inch but in fact the collet measures for a 6 mm.)
customer_reviews.author: Wudwaen

customer_reviews.title: Shank snapped at 2 feet in.
customer_reviews.text: Avid DIYer, bought this set to help with my Beekeeping hobby. As others have said, the 1/4 inch straight bit is awful. Snapped before I could make it 2 linear feet in soft pine. The 3/4 inch straight bit is okay, seems to work just has seemed to dull quickly. Lots of tear out.
customer_reviews.author: Adam S

customer_reviews.title: Cheap bits
customer_reviews.text: So far I've tried 3 bits out of this set - the flush trim bit and 2 of the roundover bits. The roundovers are just okay, altho they seem to not be very sharp. The trim flew apart within about the first 10 feet or so of wood. I wanted a cheap set to get started with using my new router and I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Jason H. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Stalwart router bit set
customer_reviews.text: Hope it’s not a sign of things to come, 1/4” straight bit broke 10 seconds after installing in router without touching workpiece yet. 3/8 and 3/4 both performed well though haven’t used others yet
customer_reviews.author: D. K. Numinen

customer_reviews.title: Great So far....
customer_reviews.text: I don't know about the longevity of these bits but they have been great so far. I have used them on soft pine and the straight bit and rounds over bits have worked perfectly. The cuts where smooth and there was no scorching. For the price I don't think you can beat this set.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Pagano

customer_reviews.title: Dull and burns wood
customer_reviews.text: Bits are very dull. I played with different router speed, feeding speed but round-over bits keep burning wood. I got Freud bit (1/4 round-over) and with same setup and settings - beautiful cut and no scorching. Spend little more money and get some quality bits.
customer_reviews.author: Sinster

customer_reviews.title: Great Set for Little $
customer_reviews.text: My husband got a router and rather than let him practice with expensive bits we purchased these. They are still being used and he originally beat the crap out of them. There are high quality bits that are worth the money but if your just tinkering around this is the set for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Buy the set its cheapper than buying one bit...
customer_reviews.text: This is a late reviews but not only the price and delivery can not be beat and I found one bit that was in this case for more money than I paid for the complete set trust me I did the hard work looing for the best price so stop here don't look no more you no one comes close to beat there price..
customer_reviews.author: Jose pepi Alicea

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: First off, great presentation of the set. I like the little box that these come in. It makes for very easy and neat storage. Second, the bits are very sharp and work well so far. I will update this review in the future if I have any discrepancies or these bits dull fast. As of using these for a couple of weeks, I definitely would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Colby M.

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money
customer_reviews.text: I only recently started using my router, but so far these bits are great, make clean cuts and you can glide through wood like it was butter.
customer_reviews.author: Leonel Barreda

customer_reviews.title: Nice set, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Good product for occasional use. I like the storage case and the bits are a decent quality and build. Minus 1 point for the poor selection of shapes of the bits. This set was cheaper than 1 router bit down at the big box store.
customer_reviews.author: Roger E

customer_reviews.title: Soft wood only
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine when I was proofing with just pine. About 30 minutes into working with maple the bit snapped and took out my collet.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Flush bit lasted 3 minutes before the bearing fell off.
customer_reviews.text: Flush bit lasted 3 minutes before the bearing fell off and screwed up a side of my speaker build. A bunch of bits for $20 sounds nice, but it really is a 24 pack of junk. Edit: Still first day using these, 2 more bits down.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: ... two uses out of each bit before it goes dull. They do the job but for anyone serious ...
customer_reviews.text: I guess I can't expect much for what I paid but don't expect to get more than one or two uses out of each bit before it goes dull. They do the job but for anyone serious about their tools it's worth it to get something of better quality.
customer_reviews.author: tllong2

customer_reviews.title: One bit is junk!
customer_reviews.text: One bit is junk! First set had a screw and wheel loose on one of the bits. Screw wouldn’t screw in. Ordered a replacement but same problem on the same bit. Not sure if I’ll ever use that specific bit but would be nice if they ALL worked as they should. Keeping kit for all the other bits.
customer_reviews.author: Nate H.

customer_reviews.title: OK for Light Work
customer_reviews.text: This is a case of you get what you pay for. I broke the 1/4" straight bit after about 10 feet of board. I bought a replacement that was of similar quality and price and it broke quickly too. Then I bought a third replacement bit that cost as much as this whole kit and there was a big difference. It held up and gave me no issues for the rest of my project. This kit is for light work on softer boards. I was using oak.
customer_reviews.author: Josh V

customer_reviews.title: I have many other bits and these don't seem as ...
customer_reviews.text: I have many other bits and these don't seem as high quality as others in my shop. I recently broke the 1/4 straight bit. Broke right in half, threw sparks, and caught surrounding saw dust on fire. Not even kidding. Flames.
customer_reviews.author: devin

customer_reviews.title: Broke in the first 2 feet
customer_reviews.text: The bits arrived just in time for me to put some trim on a project I was working on. I loaded the 1/4 radius round over bit and proceeded to cut into a 24" piece of pine when the spacing wheel broke off.
customer_reviews.author: Father0fnine

customer_reviews.title: The bearing Flew off!!!
customer_reviews.text: The bearing Flew off!!! While routing with the large roundover bit I felt something bounce off my arm and stopped my machine. Upon further inspection the the bearing had flew off. Always wear your eye protection.
customer_reviews.author: MoparMan91

customer_reviews.title: JUNK! Do not buy these bits!
customer_reviews.text: I used the 1/4" flush trim bit on a project. I got maybe 8" of cutting before the bearing spun off and the bit dug into the side of my work piece. I had already invested about 6 hours into this project, only to have it ruined by this GARBAGE bit. If you care at all about your work, save the headache and buy something else. I wish I could get both my money AND my time back.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit.
customer_reviews.text: They won't last forever but these are great for an intro into routers without breaking the bank. They leave a good finish and haven't broken. I would but these again if I was new to woodworking.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I'm poor, I don't have extra money just to blow on extras. These are great for the price. They've held up really good so far. I feel like I got a bargain for my money.
customer_reviews.author: Cary Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: These are inexpensive, but you get what you pay for. The bits are dull and the bearings fall apart. It is a nice selection though. It would be wiser to pay more and but only the bits you need.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Webb

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: These have been awesome so far. I haven't tried all of them, but the ones I have worked great. Update: 1/4/2016 - I just finished building a twin bed frame for my son. I had to use a few router bits pretty extensively to remove some material. One of them ended up bending, making it useless. Another one chipped. I took away one star, but I still consider them very good bits for the money. Basically a kit for someone just starting to use a router, but definitely not high quality pieces that are going to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Pettis

customer_reviews.title: They cut accurately and cleanly
customer_reviews.text: Since I never used a router before I tried these bits on scrap wood. After a few trial runs I got the speed of the feed right and they worked great. I then used these to add a decorative edge to a key rack I built, and it really improved the look without a lot of effort. I was using soft pine and I didn’t have any chip or breaking issues.
customer_reviews.author: JimA

customer_reviews.title: Good set to get started with, but be careful
customer_reviews.text: These were the first router bits I ever bought. I've had them for a little more than two years, and I've been able to get a good amount of use from them while I slowly "upgraded" the bits that I used the most. One important thing to note!! Before using the ones with bearings, make sure you get them tight using the provided Allen wrench!! I broke the rabbeting bit because the bearing fell off in use, resulting in an awkward angle, which bound up the router, sending a little shard of metal flying across my shop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cuts well cheep bearings
customer_reviews.text: They cut nice but some of the bearings didn’t spin at all I freed them up with a drill and pliers. they do ok for now. They cut well so it’s worth replacing the bearings
customer_reviews.author: This guy

customer_reviews.title: Bits seem to be well made
customer_reviews.text: The bearing failed on one of the bits after using it twice. It looks like the bearing was damaged from the man for during assembly onto the router bit. Using it the route the edges of new cabinet doors
customer_reviews.author: Willis B.

customer_reviews.title: Great presentation
customer_reviews.text: I both these as a gift to go along with a router i bought. Box makes for a great presentation and everything is labeled well with details on the cut. Bits seem durable and are sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Look like quality bits!
customer_reviews.text: Nice wood box. Bits look to be quality! Haven't used them yet, will write review after using them.
customer_reviews.author: Neil W. Cook

customer_reviews.title: NICE REPLACEMENT SET
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a set of Skill bits for 13 years, and needed to replace them. I am retired from the construction trade and although these bits may not be the professionals bit of choice; for my needs, little projects I now have time to complete, they are perfect. I use them in my Bosh variable speed router and have had no trouble so far.. Amazon really gave us a deal marking these down and with Prime shipping the bargain is unbeatable.. Thank you Amazon some more for helping the working girl...
customer_reviews.author: ronneenwalker

customer_reviews.title: Bearings explode, don't trust these.
customer_reviews.text: I've had several bits with bearings explode on me in use, they are very dangerous. Do not trust these bits!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bob

customer_reviews.title: This kit is exactly what I expected, it does ...
customer_reviews.text: This kit is exactly what I expected, it does the job well but the quality of the bits makes me question it's longevity under extensive use. My need to route is very infrequent and minimal so I expect to squeeze a significant life span out of this set.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: ... Dewalt Router I bought from Amazon and it's a great starter set for anyone who's serious into routing and ...
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for my husband a paired perfectly with the Dewalt Router I bought from Amazon and it's a great starter set for anyone who's serious into routing and the great thing about it is you can continue to build on this collection and the price is very reasonable
customer_reviews.author: Marie Franks

customer_reviews.title: Nice set!
customer_reviews.text: Like the case and all the pieces, have used one of the pieces and it was sharp. Recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: 1stNikon

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Good item for weekend woodworkers. Not sure about longevity for professional use.
customer_reviews.author: Joel R

customer_reviews.title: Ahhh so so
customer_reviews.text: If you are using these on softer woods they are probably fine. If you use them on the harder species, you'll quickly notice the quality. It isn't very high. The price is nice, but the quality does reflect it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Received duplicate bit in lieu of the one I needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because buying a single bit at Home Depot is ~$30 and figured I might as well just get a whole set. I needed the Chamfer bit, but in its place they gave me a second rabbeting bit. The only one I needed immediately wasn't in the set.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Money's worth...
customer_reviews.text: I honestly haven't had much of a chance to try all the bits, but I have used a couple. I'm a small time carpenter. I work out of my shed. These bits will be perfect. They don't seem to be too cheap but then again, they don't look like a $300 set. If you are in construction or a simple DIYer like me and need some router bits on occasion, I think you will find these bits to be adequate for your needs. Anything else, not so much. The wood box they come in was ok, the locks tho I will replace. Other than that, you get what you pay for. Definiitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: R & D Henson

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay(not much) for
customer_reviews.text: Cheap bits, can tell they are of low quality just from looking at them, but they serve the purpose they are meant to: (Be cheap and give some starter bits to someone to learn with, before they know what they really need/want, so that they can buy better later)
customer_reviews.author: Michael A

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: My experience was very consistent with other buyers, these are poor quality and don't hold up well at all. I've had to change plans several times mid project due to the bits not making it through the project (and most are pine). The bearing in particular fail regularly. Spend a little more on something of higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Aranda

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to make a set of basic photo frames for Christmas presents. used these to bevel edges and rabbet. They got the job done, they definitely began to get dull after about 100 brd/ft. The guide on one of the bevel bits broke, but considering the entire set cost less than a single high quality bit, you really can't complain. I would always advise safety glasses but they are even more imperative if you choose to use these, guides breaking at high speeds could be dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Huff

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Just like they were advertised, work perfectly. this is a perfect starter set for someone who wants to get started using a router and doesn't need extremely high end bits. they cut and don't dull up thanks to the carbide.
customer_reviews.author: Ian M. Mears

customer_reviews.title: Solid set
customer_reviews.text: This is a great and complete set of routing bits. They seem to be durable though I have not used them all.
customer_reviews.author: schlemm

customer_reviews.title: Bearing fell off in 2 minutes of usage
customer_reviews.text: Well, I should have adhered to the other reviews. The bearing fell off the first bit I used within 2 minutes of usage. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Alesa

customer_reviews.title: Great bits for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good buy for someone doing small project. Bits won't last for the daily user. Have plenty of options for trim or tables.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Forgensi

customer_reviews.title: Garbage bits
customer_reviews.text: Ball bearing just broke off the flush trim bit my first time using it, right around 1 foot of cut wood. Ruined my template and piece I was cutting. The blades have also been chipping very quickly, like first time using the bits. These are trash.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Do not expect these to last.
customer_reviews.text: These seem to cut ok, and there's a good selection of them, but the bearings are junk! I've had two fall apart with next to no use.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected. Great value. Used a few times so not sure of longevity but haven’t seen any issues yet.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Good price nice item
customer_reviews.text: Got my Husband a router and really needed these he said just what he needed he said they are really durable.
customer_reviews.author: Murph

customer_reviews.title: great packaging
customer_reviews.text: the bits were neat, organized and packaged well. Like the wooden container and item descriptions. Just hoping the last thru many cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Davignon

customer_reviews.title: First, arrived with holes (2) in the bottom of ...
customer_reviews.text: First, arrived with holes (2) in the bottom of the wood box. Not a big deal since the important items are the bits themselves not the box they arrive in. Secondly, first bit I took out, the screw to hold the bearing on was stripped out of it (scrap, can't use safely). I did use a few (4) of the bits already and they cut well but a stripped out screw? Come on, you shipped the Customer what should have been scrapped out from the production line. Overall, 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Worth the price but not for professional use. I’m a beginner so very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Product had a tiny bit of rust no problem, great value for the dollar versus quality
customer_reviews.author: Jesusita Peralez

customer_reviews.title: Not too badd
customer_reviews.text: Work well for the price but have started to break due to Cheaper quality. Probly would spend a little bit more to get one that will last. Good for a beginner
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: My father in-law loves it.
customer_reviews.text: We have not had this product long but I got it for my father in-law and he love it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Destiny Sizemore

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: The very first time I used it, it bent at the shaft, I wouldn’t recommend this junk!
customer_reviews.author: Sam A.

customer_reviews.title: I tell you this is awesome my hubby loves to make things with wood
customer_reviews.text: I tell you this is awesome my hubby loves to make things with wood, and he said one day I wish I had a router and I said babe you mean the bits and he said yes I showed him these online and his eyes opened up so wide he got three early Father's days presents and this one made his day, he especially loves the box that it came in !!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Router Bit Set- 24 Piece Kit with ¼” Shank and Wood Storage Case By Stalwart (Woodworking Tools for Home Improvement and DIY)
product_meta.description:
Size:24 pcPrecision woodworking is readily at your fingertips with the Stalwart 24-piece router bit set. Featuring 15 different bits with ¼ inch shaft bits that fit all routers, this set is ideal for the person just staring out or the experienced pro.

IMPORTANT:
Avoid buying counterfeit products and transacting with unauthorized sellers. Look for our logo on the packaging for every one of our products. Stalwart is committed to providing the consumer with the absolute best price and value on all of our products, which we ensure by applying a rigorous Quality Control process. Stalwart a registered trademark protected by U.S. Trademark law and will be vigorously defended.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
This is a great set for the woodworker just starting out or anyone needing a commercial quality set of bits. This same set is being sold by popular catalogs and online retailers for a lot more money. These yellow bits do cut well and are a great value.
feature_bullets: DURABLE CONSTRUCTION – Stalwart’s carbide tipped router bits are built to last and are constructed using high quality materials. Along with the sturdy wooden case, this durable router bit set will allow you to complete all your projects with confidence.

MULTIFUNCTIONAL SET -  With 24 included pieces, this kit is great for multipurpose uses. It is perfect for woodworking, edging, trimming, grooving, veining wood projects, and ideal for carpenters and hobbyists of all experience levels. This set also includes an allen wrench for removing bearings.

EASY TO STORE- The included wooden case is sturdy and makes storing the high-quality router bits convenient while in-between jobs or DIY home improvement projects. The case also helps protect the bits while traveling to work on the go or remote site locations

SET INCLUDES- 1/2 mortising bit, 1/2 combination bevel bit, 3/8 dovetail bit, 1/2 dovetail bit, 1/2 90 degree V-groove bit, 3/8 round nose bit, 1/2 round nose bit, 3/8 trimming bit, 1/4 panel pilot bit, 1/4 straight bit, 3/8 straight bit, 1/2 straight bit, 3/4 straight bit, 1/2 flush trim bit, 1/8 radius round over bit, 3/16 radius round over bit, 1/4 radius round over bit, 3/8 radius round over bit, 1/4 cove bit, 3/8 cove bit, 1/2 45 degree chamfer bit, 1/4 Roman Ogee bit, 1/4 slot cutter bit, 1/2 rabeting bit, wood case

Router bit bits set tongue and groove wood doors flooring shaker door routers panel shank joint 1 2 storage kit holder for cabinet sets inch case box plywood tool tools accessories DIY home improvement
